I have 3000+ hours of competitive play across all my accounts. I think this is a great game but no, I would not recommend it to others. Also, full disclosure this game ruined me.

This game all but begs you to try to improve at it. It's very organic to play but impossibly difficult to master. You have an aiming system that highly depends on you hitting their small head, and to do it as fast as you can react basically. You have a movement system such that you have to counter strafe in order to decelerate yourself otherwise your shot will not be on target. And then finally you have the team-based aspect, which is by far the biggest factor actually. You tend to win 50% of your games. It pretty much all depends on whether your teammates are decent and/or cooperate and want to win. A small percentage of people can "carry" (I would think like 5%), but I think most of the time it's just people having a good day. My point is there are too many variables in this game to perfect and as a result I just don't think it's worth your time. This is meant to be played competitively, I feel, but the skill curve takes too long and you may never improve much at all.

If you do play it and want to take it seriously, after about 100-300 hours (depending on how well you do) I would jump over to a third party server system (versus the built in competitive system). It's better servers and most importantly better opposition and of course teammates. Look up ESEA or FaceIt.

If you do play it and take it seriously, then godspeed. I wish you way more than luck.

✞ One of the best games of all time. But after a long break, Valve probably scored already on Counter-Strike: Global Offensive, as it is currently covered with chaos, and cheaters. But I hope that in the future they will look around and make the game more streamlined and convenient for ordinary players. In the end, it is we who make this game popular. So let's look into the future and play this beautiful game without aggressing. Which envelops our life and our youth ✞
